benchmark_details.name: DialogBench
benchmark_details.overview: DialogBench is a dialogue evaluation benchmark that contains 12 dialogue tasks to probe the capabilities of LLMs as human-like dialogue systems. It aims to standardize the evaluation of LLMs and identify their strengths and limitations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs as human-like dialogue systems across multiple dimensions of human-likeness.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: DialogBench currently only supports evaluation in English and Chinese, limiting its multilingual applicability.

data.source: Generated dialogues using GPT-4 as a surrogate to create evaluation instances based on human-like dialogue tasks.
data.annotation: Automatically generated with manual filtering for quality control.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on multiple-choice question performance across various dialogue tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy scores indicate better performance on dialogue tasks, reflecting a more human-like interaction capability.
methodology.baseline_results: Human-level accuracy scores were used as a benchmark for comparison.
methodology.validation: The constructed evaluation tasks were tested on 26 different LLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Care was taken to ensure no personal data was included in generated instances.
